learning_objective: Compare how people live and work before and after the implementation or adoption of new computing technology.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is a budding musician and has recently taken up music composition and arrangement. Alex recalls from their music history lesson that composers many years ago used to write their music by hand with pen and manuscript paper. Now, Alex uses various music notation software to write down and edit compositions. Which of the following does NOT apply to how music composition and arrangement has evolved due to technology?",
    "Answer1": "With music notation software, Alex can play back the music to hear how it sounds, which was not possible with traditional hand-written notation.",
    "Answer2": "New technology enables songs to be composed faster and more accurately without human errors in counting measures or lines.",
    "Answer3": "Music notation software allows for easier sharing and collaboration, rather than waiting for handwritten composition to be manually distributed.",
    "Answer4": "Composing music with software has caused the creativity and emotion behind compositions to be lost, unlike in the past when music was written by hand.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "4",
    "Explanation": "While it is true that technology has made it easier to compose and arrange music, it doesn't necessarily mean that the creativity and emotion behind writing music have been lost. Technology is a tool that assists musicians in bringing their ideas to life faster and more accurately, but the origin of these ideas still lies in the human imagination and emotion."
}
